definition: to reside/to be (in a certain position)/to store up/to be at a standstill/residence/house/restaurant/classifier for bedrooms
(archaic) sentence-final particle expressing a doubting attitude
gap/to separate/to thin out (seedlings)/to sow discontent
between/among/within a definite time or space/room/section of a room or lateral space between two pairs of pillars/classifier for rooms

sentences.english: U.N. Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon, who mediated this latest round of negotiations, is an unfailing optimist.
sentences.chinese: 在最近一次会谈中居间调停的是联合国秘书长潘基文。

sentences.english: Revenues earned from compensation for intermediary and agent business or for acting as an assignee.
sentences.chinese: 指因居间及代理业务或受委讬等报酬所得之收入。

definition: to write for sb else/a lawyer who writes legal documents for his clients
to conclude (treaty, contract, agreement etc)/to set up (a rule etc)
to suit one's taste/suitable/congenial/by mutual agreement
second party (law)/see also 甲方[jia3 fang1]
to be involved in a lawsuit
